[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Type Conversion Loss] Do the into() calls properly handle maximum values without data loss, or can large version numbers be truncated during type conversion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Timestamp Conversion] Can block_timestamp.into() in line 159 cause timestamp overflow or wraparound when converting to different time representations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_block_by_height()] [Path Injection] Does Path<u64> extraction for block_height properly validate the path parameter, or can path traversal or injection attacks manipulate the block_height value? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_block_by_version()] [Path Injection] Can the Path<u64> extraction for version in line 86 be exploited with specially crafted paths to bypass validation or access unintended versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_block_by_height()] [Negative Block Height] Even though block_height is u64, can URL encoding tricks inject negative values that get misinterpreted after Path extraction? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Memory Leak] If render_transactions_sequential() allocates large vectors for transactions but then fails, are these properly freed, or can repeated failures cause memory leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_by_height()] [Unbounded Allocation] When retrieving blocks with transactions, is there a size limit on the block data, or can attackers request blocks that allocate gigabytes of memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_by_version()] [Unbounded Allocation] Can large blocks with many transactions cause unbounded memory allocation in line 132, leading to OOM kills of the API server? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Transaction Order] Does render_transactions_sequential() preserve transaction order exactly as committed, or can reordering occur that violates deterministic execution guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Transaction Completeness] When bcs_block.transactions is Some, is the transaction list guaranteed to be complete, or can partial transaction sets be returned without indication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Transaction Duplication] Can bugs in transaction rendering cause the same transaction to appear multiple times in the block response, breaking idempotency assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Block Timestamp Manipulation] Is block_timestamp validated to be monotonically increasing compared to previous blocks, or can manipulated timestamps break time-based logic in clients? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [First/Last Version Gap] Are first_version and last_version validated to be continuous (no gaps), or can corrupted blocks expose version gaps that violate chain continuity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Block Height Discontinuity] Is block_height validated to increment by 1 from the previous block, or can discontinuous heights cause chain validation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_block_by_height()] [Documentation Mismatch] Does the OpenAPI documentation accurately reflect security constraints, or can documentation mismatches cause clients to make unsafe assumptions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_block_by_version()] [Operation ID Collision] Is the operation_id unique, or can collisions with other endpoints cause API routing errors or security bypasses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_by_height()] [Context Corruption] If the Context object is corrupted or poisoned, does get_block_by_height() detect this and fail safely, or can corrupted context return invalid block data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_by_version()] [Context State Inconsistency] Can inconsistent state in the Context object cause get_block_by_version() to return blocks that don't match the current ledger state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: render_bcs_block()] [Context Method Safety] Does render_transactions_sequential() handle context errors safely, or can context method failures cause undefined behavior in rendering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/blocks.rs] [Function: get_block_by_height()] [Multiple Query Parameters] If with_transactions is specified multiple times in the query string, which value is used, and can this cause inconsistent behavior? (Low)
